channel.title: Alternate DNS server and IP address?
channel.description: I'm trying to set a static IP as my server currently stopped working, my port forwarding is correct. Although I haven't set a static IP address yet. I'm currently running on a Windows XP® and I'm at internet protocol, I'm wondering if the IP should be the one I type in to the address bar (example: 192.168.*.*) or the IP address in run>cmd>ipconfig and what does preferred DNS server and the Alternate DNS server mean?

item.title: Alternate DNS server and IP address?
item.dc:creator: @Cuban0_Ftw Cuban0 Ftw
item.description:
@Cuban0_Ftw wrote:

Okay what would the Preferred and Alternate DNS be?

Read full topic
item.source: Alternate DNS server and IP address?

item.title: Alternate DNS server and IP address?
item.dc:creator: @mochronik mochronik
item.description:
@mochronik wrote:

type in you’re default gateway in the address bar

so yes: the 198.168..

Read full topic
